intro: [WRONG START] Astellia alpina var. alpina, commonly known as the alpine astelia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its rosette-forming growth habit and produces tall, slender flowering stems that bear clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, thriving in well-drained, rocky soils. It is adapted to cold climates and can withstand harsh winter conditions. Astelia alpina var. alpina is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens with suitable growing conditions.
